it works in the same config with a jdk 1.5.0_09

So it fails with Java 6 but works with Java 5? I'm not sure how this would affect this, but anyway...

How did this conversation get initiated? Did you double-click on someone's name and then try to send the message or did someone else start the conversation and you started typing in that window?

Just a wild guess: Do we have code that relies on the fact that accessing a class object using SomeClass.class runs SomeClass's static initializers?  This used to work in Java 5 but doesn't work anymore in Java 6.
Setting target milestone to 1.0.2.  Does comment #3 describe the situation at all?

(In reply to comment #4)
> Does comment #3 describe the situation at
> all?

It might. I'm pretty sure I have static initializers but I don't recall any SomeClass.class code. I also tend to invoke my second Eclipse instance using 1.4.2. Boris, do you know if that Java 5 thing worked for Java 1.4.2?
